creator: jclark@inetco.com
text:
When using native library, memory usage continues to increase on our test server, and then after a day the Tomcat service is stopped with a generated hs error log file.  Physical memory usage is far beyond (above 2 GB) the configured limits we set for the JVM.

This was not an issue using Tomcat versions from before June (sorry I don't have exact version numbers for these).

#
# A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:
#
#  EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION (0xc0000005) at pc=0x1a6cb41b, pid=9616, tid=9064
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (7.0_40-b43) (build 1.7.0_40-b43)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (24.0-b56 mixed mode windows-x86 )
# Problematic frame:
# C  [tcnative-1.dll+0x1b41b]
#
# Failed to write core dump. 
#
# If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:
#   http://bugreport.sun.com/bugreport/crash.jsp
# The crash happened outside the Java Virtual Machine in native code.
# See problematic frame for where to report the bug.
#

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
The Address.getip code is unchanged since 2006.

I've been unable to recreate this issue, nor have I found any similar reports.

My working assumption at this point is that there was a memory leak that has since been fixed. If you are still experiencing this error then we'll need enough information to reproduce it (including exact version numbers) to investigate further.
